Not good ğŸ™ˆ


A survey of 1,576 researchers found that over 70% had failed to reproduce another scientistâ€™s experiments, and more than 50% couldnâ€™t reproduce their own results!

title: The ğŸ’ª of {targets} for  Reproducible Data Science
text:
/motivation/reproducibility-crisis












Gosh! â˜ ï¸


A 2019 paper found just 24% of 800k Jupyter notebooks on GitHub could be rerun, and only 4% reproduced the same results!

title: The ğŸ’ª of {targets} for  Reproducible Data Science
text:
/motivation/reproducibility-crisis












Say it isnâ€™t so! ğŸ¤¯


A 2024 study on code reproducibility in economics. attempted to reproduce 67 economics papers and found that only about 50% were reproducible, even with author assistance and mandatory code-sharing policies at journals!

title: The ğŸ’ª of {targets} for  Reproducible Data Science
text:
/{targets}/what-is-it?

Author Will Landau explainsâ€¦

A make-like pipeline tool that coordinates the pieces of computationally demanding analyses
The package skips costly run-time for tasks that are already up to date
It orchestrates computation, handles parallel computing
If all the current output matches the code and data, then the whole pipeline is up to date, and the results are more trustworthy



{targets} released in ~2021 is a successor to {drake}

title: The ğŸ’ª of {targets} for  Reproducible Data Science

/{targets}/what-is-it?
To hereâ€¦

title: The ğŸ’ª of {targets} for  Reproducible Data Science
text:
Workshop Sequence
The workshop is structured to build your skills step-by-step, from foundational concepts to advanced features:
Fundamentals

01-basics
Get started with the core concepts of {targets} and build your first pipeline.
02-functions
Modularize your workflow by writing and sourcing custom functions for use in your pipeline.
03-files
Handle file inputs and outputs, and integrate Quarto documents for automated reporting.

Advanced Topics

04-parallel
Accelerate your pipelines by leveraging parallel computing for faster execution.
05-dynamic_branching
Scale your analysis with dynamic branching to process multiple groups or files efficiently.
06-database
Integrate databases into your workflow for robust and scalable data management.
07-full_example
A comprehensive example that brings together all previous concepts, including parameterized reporting and advanced workflow management.

what weâ€™ll coverâ€¦
what I wonâ€™t coverâ€¦

You feel confident building and scaling your own analytical pipelines.
You see how modular code, automation, and good workflow design can save you time and headaches.
Youâ€™re inspired to bring these best practices to your own projects and teams.
